description.en: During the course, students will read texts and listen to lectures or talks in their field of study, complete vocabulary and listening tasks. Students are expected to have a language proficiency level of at least B2 (CEFR).
description.et: Kursusel loetakse erialaseid tekste ning kuulatakse erialaseid loenguid, tehakse sõnavara- ning kuulamisülesandeid. Osalejatelt eeldatakse vähemalt B2 keeleoskustaset.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to expand students' vocabulary and develop their listening and reading skills in the fields of physics, chemistry and materials science.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on sõnavara laiendamine ning kuulamis- ja lugemisoskuse parandamine erialaste teemade raames.

learning_outcomes.en: On completion of the course, students will have expanded their vocabulary; know how to make academic presentations; will have developed reading and listening skills in their field of study.
learning_outcomes.et: Üliõpilane on omandanud kursuse raames läbitud sõnavara; oskab teha akadeemilist erialast ettekannet; on arendanud erialaste tekstide lugemis- ja kuulamisoskust.

notes.et:
1. By registering for this course you agree with the course requirements and policies.
2. Please note the deadline for dropping the course. If you want to drop the course after the deadline, you need to contact the study coordinator (marilii.adamson (at) ut.ee).
3. You are expected to maintain the highest standards of academic integrity. Academic misconduct (copying text/sentences and presenting it as one's own, not using paraphrasing, not crediting the sources) will be penalised according to the university's regulations.
4. All study debts need to be settled by Jan 14 (tasks)/16 (tests), 2023.
5. You can sit each test twice.
6. This is not a grammar/writing course.
7. This course is non-graded (pass/fail). Foreign and Erasmus exchange students can get a course attainment percentage at the end of the course. If they want the attainment percentage, they need to inform me in advance.
8. Failing to meet deadlines constantly results in failing the course. If you need extension, let me know in advance!
9. I do not read and assess overdue written tasks.
10. In case of any problems, contact me right away to find a solution.

independent_work.et:
1. Pronunciation exercise - Read the infosheet about spoken mathematics and chemical formulas. Find out how to read the numbers, expressions, equations and formulas in the task out loud. Record your reading in the Assignment tool and submit the task by the deadline. The task is a prerequisite for sitting Test 1.
2. Summary of a given article (300 words) - Write a 300-word summary of the Scientific Method article. Submit the task by the deadline with the Assignment tool. More specific guidelines are on Moodle. The task is a prerequisite for sitting Test 1.
3. Summary of an academic article chosen by the student (300 words) - Choose a scientific article written in English in the field of your study (chemistry, physics, materials science). The article needs to have at least 10 pages of text (illustrations, tables, schematics, foot/endnotes and used sources list excluded). Write a 300-word English summary of the article and submit the summary + the original article by the deadline with the Assignment tool. The task is a prerequisite for sitting Test 2.
4. Transcript of an academic presentation - You need to give a 10-minute academic presentation about the scientific article you read and wrote a summary about. Write a word-by-word transcript of your presentation according to the rules and guidelines given in the Presentation Aid document. The length of the transcript is two A4-s with single spacing and 12pts shrift. 
5. Reading, listening, doing vocabulary and comprehension exercises

More detailed instructions are on the course's Moodle page
